page.title: 02 Land Use and Ecology
page.content: The area is flat and low-lying, below 8m a.s.l.,and used to be marshy "Carr lands". The heavy boulder clay {soil}has been drained by many ditches which feed the{HOLDERNESS DRAIN.}This contains Roach,Perch,Pike,Bream,Tench and eels, but in June 1985 it was {polluted}by pig slurry and many fish died. There is only one small wood, at Ganstead, which contains a rookery. 70 species of bird were recorded, including Kingfisher,Little Owl and Sparrowhawk, but hedgerows are being removed. The 8{farms}are mainly arable or mixed.The main{crops}are wheat,barley and oilseed rape,with smaller areas of vegetables,ley and permanent grass. Ganstead farm has 200 sheep and 118 bullocks for fattening.There is one dairy herd.
